com.conceptwave.scripting
Class Calendar

com.conceptwave.scripting.Object
  com.conceptwave.scripting.CWScriptable
      com.conceptwave.scripting.Calendar

public class Calendar
extends CWScriptable

Contains static functions for date/time manipulation. Date components are referred to by one of the following constants:

  • Calendar.DATE_DAY
  • Calendar.DATE_HOUR
  • Calendar.DATE_MINUTE
  • Calendar.DATE_SECOND

Method Detail

formatDate

public static String formatDate(Date date,
                                String format)
Format a date/time object for a given format string. For example: Calendar._formatDate(new Date(), "yyyy.MM.dd hh:mm:ss") returns "2004.02.04 12:52:45".

Parameters:
date - Date/time to format.
format - Format string. Refer to data formats for data elements in the designer user guide for a list of available formats.
Returns:
Formatted date/time string.

getDate

public static Date getDate(Date date)
Sets time component of a date to 00:00:00.

Parameters:
date - Date or timestamp.
Returns:
The date with the time component set to 0

getDays

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer getDays(String calName,
                                                        Date startDate,
                                                        Date endDate)
Calculate working days between two dates for a given calendar.

Parameters:
calName - Metadata name of calendar. If null the default calendar is used. If a calendar with a given name doesn't exist an exception will be thrown.
startDate - Start date.
endDate - date.
Returns:
int Duration in days.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if calendar not found.

getDueDate

public static Date getDueDate(String calName,
                              Date startDate,
                              com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer duration,
                              com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer durationType)
Calculates a due date given a calendar, date and duration. Non working hours are skipped.

Parameters:
calName - Metadata name of calendar. If null the default calendar is used. If a calendar with a given name doesn't exist an exception will be thrown.
startDate - Starting date.
duration - Duration to add to starting date
durationType - Optional type of duration. May be one of: Calendar._DATE_DAY, Calendar._DATE_HOUR, or Calendar._DATE_MINUTE. If not specified the duration is asumed in seconds
Returns:
Date The due date.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if calendar not found.

getDuration

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer getDuration(String calName,
                                                            Date startDate,
                                                            Date endDate)
Calculate duration in working seconds between two dates for a given calendar.

Parameters:
calName - Metadata name of calendar. If null the default calendar is used. If a calendar with a given name doesn't exist an exception will be thrown.
startDate - Start date.
endDate - End date.
Returns:
Duration in seconds.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if calendar not found.

getWorkingDay

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer getWorkingDay(String calName)
Returns the number of seconds in the working day for calendar named calName.

Parameters:
calName - Metadata name of calendar. If null the default calendar is used. If a calendar with a given name doesn't exist an exception will be thrown.
Returns:
Number of seconds in working day.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if calendar not found.

isBusinessDay

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean isBusinessDay(String calName,
                                                              Date date)
Checks if a given date is a business date

Parameters:
calName - String Calendar name. If null the default calendar is used. If a calendar with a given name doesn't exist an exception will be thrown.
date - Date to check
Returns:
True if the given date is a business date
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - when reading the calendar

isDateBefore

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean isDateBefore(Date date1,
                                                             Date date2,
                                                             com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer offset,
                                                             com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer offsetType)
Returns true if date1 is before date2 plus an offset.

Parameters:
date1 - First date.
date2 - Second date.
offset - Optional. If not specified or null or 0 no offset is added to date2.
offsetType - Optional. Offset type. Used only if the date 2 offset is specified and is not null or 0. May be one of: Calendar._DATE_DAY, Calendar._DATE_HOUR, or Calendar._DATE_MINUTE.Object, Calendar._DATE_SECOND. If not specified or null offest Calendar._DATE_DAY is assumed.
Returns:
True if date1 is before date2 + offset.

parseDate

public static Date parseDate(String dateStr,
                             String format)
Parse a formatted date/time string and return a date or timestamp object.

Parameters:
dateStr - Date/time to format.
format - Format string. Refer to data formats for data elements in the designer user guide for a list of available formats.
Returns:
Date The date or timestamp
Throws:
ParseException - if the date string or format are invalid

today

public static Date today()
Returns todays date. Time component is set to 00:00:00.

Returns:
Todays date midnight.
